content.description:
An all holds in version of Wampa's Revenge

Squat start on the corner jug.  Move up along the corner and face left of the corner.
Pads

Superb V2!

Stand start on blocky edges.  Bust up and slightly left, using side-pulls for the right hand and blocky edges for the left.  Hit the lip, chuck a right heel over the edge and rock over for a full value finish, or wuss out and traverse right and finish on the sissy blocks.
A pad and a spotter

Links the start of Mon Cal into the start of Mr. T with a mantle finish on the ledge above the roof. Stand start in the cave with left hand on the rail under the roof, right hand on the sidepull in the roof. Traverse right on the crimp rail, make a reachy move to the lip above the roof and finish with a tricky mantle on the the ledge.

Could be V3 for shorter people or if you don't know how to fingerlock. The boulder under the roof is not in, otherwise this is V0.

 I doubt this is a first ascent but I couldn't find any info on it anywhere and the finish is completely chalk free.



East side of the east boulder. Look for the cave where Mon Cal starts.

One pad is enough

A fantastic compression route out of the cave on the northeast corner of the East Rock.

On the northeast corner of the East Rock in the cave.  Squat start on the jug where the roof meets the vertical block. Left hand into an incut crimp on the roof, right hand out to a slopey pinch.  Move straight out of the cave squeezing the block and using some tricky foot magic.  Using the Rock to the left of the crack is out.  Exit up the crack after reaching the good jug, or, if you have balls of steel or a death wish, climb straight up the face.
Pads, spotters only needed on the exit.

Starting on the far left on the North side of the East rock.  Start low and traverse from left to right, staying low.  Finish with the blocky arret.  Feet are huge, hands are terrible.  Much harder for shorter people, but still worth the effort.

East rock, North face.
Maybe a pad in the center crux area.  You are never all that far off the ground.

Lower start

Left and down from The Rez is a sloping block/pinch. Squat start on this.  Move up to the side pulls, then the jug.  Traverse right into the starting crimps of The Rez and finish same as the Rez.
One or 2 pads

Start on crimps just under the undercling flake (short people may need to stand on something to reach the start holds, however the jump start to the holds goes at the same grade).  Pull up into undercling flake with really bad feet and make the toss for the good edge up high.  Will frustrate you until you stick the move, and then you'll want to do it again.

Located on the north face of east boulder, on the center of far right face.
One well placed pad should to the trick

Stand start on crimp rail below a small roof. Navigate crimps and sidepulls straight up, veering right and then back left to finish on the not so obvious jug below the roof (reachy move to the left). Up to this jug felt like V3, could be harder if you decide to top out but the huge boulder behind the route makes the top out very spicy (R). 

If you finish at the jug you can jump on said boulder to get down.

*disclaimer: We spotted this line and it had no chalk whatsoever, and there isn't any description of it anywhere. If you know of an official first ascent of this let me know.



East Boulder south face. As you walk up to the erratics from the lot, look for the obvious big rock at the base of the east boulder, the route starts immediately to the right of it.

A few pads, spotters are recommended as a fall could be nasty due to the boulder behind the route.

Decent route, a bit of an eliminate

Sit start low and to the left of the corner on 2 big jugs.  Make a thuggy dead-point to another edge via a pinch.  Using blocky edges and pinches, and avoiding the holds along the arret make your way up the a small 3 finger crimp where 2 seams converge a foot and a half below the lip.  Finish straight over the lip.
a few pads could help, the landing is somewhat blocky
The east side of Big Rock
